metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The FOREIGN KEY constraint is a key used to link two tables together.
content.html: The FOREIGN KEY constraint is a key used to link two tables together.

content.text: A FOREIGN KEY is a field (or collection of fields) in one table that refers to the PRIMARY KEY in another table.
content.html: A FOREIGN KEY is a field (or collection of fields) in one table that refers to the PRIMARY KEY in another table.

content.text: SQL FOREIGN KEY on CREATE TABLE
The following SQL creates a FOREIGN KEY on the "PersonID" column when the "Orders" table is created:
content.html: The following SQL creates a FOREIGN KEY on the "PersonID" column when the "Orders" table is created:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(
   
OrderID int NOT NULL,
   
OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
   
PersonID int,
   
PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
   
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID) REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

content.code:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(

OrderID int NOT NULL,

OrderNumber int NOT NULL,

PersonID int,

PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),

FOREIGN KEY (PersonID) REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

syntax_highlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(
   
OrderID int NOT NULL,
   
OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
   
PersonID int,
   
PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
   
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID) REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

content.code_html:
CREATE TABLE Orders (
    OrderID int NOT NULL,
    OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
    PersonID int,
    PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
    FOREIGN KEY (PersonID) REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(
   
OrderID int NOT NULL,
   
OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
   
PersonID int,
   
PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
   
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID) REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

content.code_html:
CREATE TABLE Orders (
    OrderID int NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
    PersonID int FOREIGN KEY REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

content.text: To allow naming of a FOREIGN KEY constraint, and for defining a FOREIGN KEY constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:
content.html: To allow naming of a FOREIGN KEY constraint, and for defining a FOREIGN KEY constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:

content.text: MySQL / SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(
   
OrderID int NOT NULL,
   
OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
   
PersonID int,
   
PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
   
CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
   
REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

content.code:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(

OrderID int NOT NULL,

OrderNumber int NOT NULL,

PersonID int,

PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),

CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)

REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

syntax_highlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(
   
OrderID int NOT NULL,
   
OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
   
PersonID int,
   
PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
   
CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
   
REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

content.code_html:
CREATE TABLE Orders (
    OrderID int NOT NULL,
    OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
    PersonID int,
    PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
    CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
    REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
CREATE TABLE Orders
(
   
OrderID int NOT NULL,
   
OrderNumber int NOT NULL,
   
PersonID int,
   
PRIMARY KEY (OrderID),
   
CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
   
REFERENCES Persons(PersonID)
);

content.text: SQL FOREIGN KEY on ALTER TABLE
To create a FOREIGN KEY constraint on the "PersonID" column when the "Orders" table is already created, use the following SQL:
content.html: To create a FOREIGN KEY constraint on the "PersonID" column when the "Orders" table is already created, use the following SQL:

content.text: MySQL / SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Orders
ADD FOREIGN KEY (PersonID) REFERENCES Persons(PersonID);

content.text: To allow naming of a FOREIGN KEY constraint, and for defining a FOREIGN KEY constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:
content.html: To allow naming of a FOREIGN KEY constraint, and for defining a FOREIGN KEY constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:

content.text: MySQL / SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
ADD CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
REFERENCES Persons(PersonID);

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Orders
ADD CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
REFERENCES Persons(PersonID);

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
ADD CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
REFERENCES Persons(PersonID);

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Orders
ADD CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID) REFERENCES Persons(PersonID);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
ADD CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder
FOREIGN KEY (PersonID)
REFERENCES Persons(PersonID);

content.text: To drop a FOREIGN KEY constraint, use the following SQL:
content.html: To drop a FOREIGN KEY constraint, use the following SQL:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP FOREIGN KEY FK_PersonOrder;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP FOREIGN KEY FK_PersonOrder;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP FOREIGN KEY FK_PersonOrder;

content.code_html:

DROP FOREIGN KEY FK_PersonOrder;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP FOREIGN KEY FK_PersonOrder;

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Orders
DROP CONSTRAINT FK_PersonOrder;
